title: Calgary Social Media Breakfast #SMByyc69 - EXCLUSIVE SPORTS CLUB Open to Everyone
text:
October 24, 2015 12:06 ET Calgary Social Media Breakfast #SMByyc69 - EXCLUSIVE SPORTS CLUB Open to Everyone 
Social Media Breakfast Calgary #69 
8:30 am - 10:30 am, Friday, October 30th, 2015 
Calgary Marriott Hotel Downtown 
CALGARY, ALBERTA--(Marketwired - Oct. 24, 2015) - Calgary Social Media Breakfast (SMByyc) is pleased to announce October 2015 Topic: EXCLUSIVE SPORTS CLUB open to everyone 
A short list of cities has the legacy of hosting the Winter Olympic Games. Calgary's Winsport belongs to this exclusive club. Formerly known as the Calgary Olympic Development Association (CODA), Winsport was founded in 1956 to bid on behalf of Calgary to host Olympic Winter Games. CODA successfully won the bid from the International Olympic Committee on Sept. 30, 1981, for Calgary to become the host city for the XV Olympic Winter Games in 1988. Following the Olympics in 1988 and benefiting from endowment funds left for the Games' legacy, CODA has evolved into a new vision for Canadian winter sport, with the transition to Winsport. Through Winsport, the legacy of the 1988 Games is not only thriving, but leading edge. The organization built new facilities and operated, maintained and rejuvenated the facilities from the Games and is committed to supporting Canadian athletes for generations to come with the creation of the world's leading Winter Sports Institute. 
60 years after CODA was founded, SMByyc has invited Winsport to share information about current programming, talk about how Winsport will continue to stay leading edge, and how they continue to support both high-performance athletes and recreational programming. 
Winsport is an organization that gives people the opportunity to fall in love with winter sports. They are more than the physical structure at COP. Thru various sites in areas surrounding Calgary, they promote athletic development from recreational participation to high performance sport development. A panel, which includes representatives from Calgary area resorts Lake Louise Ski Resort and Resorts of the Canadian Rockies , will reflect on their marketing strategies and how they get people excited about winter sports. 
Seating is limited. 
Please RSVP at SMByyc69 
If you are not able to attend, follow and join in on the discussion @SMByyc via #SMByyc69 . 
Or check out #SMByyc69 Tagboard : SMByyc69_TB 
Collection of posts from Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Flickr, Google+ and Vine 
About the Event 
When: Friday, October 30 th , 8:30 to 10:30 a.m. Where: 110 - 9 th Avenue S.E. Calgary, AB T2G 5A6 
Cost: There is no fee to attend a Social Media Breakfast. 
Parking: Map & Parking instructions will be sent to all who RSVP to event. 
Registration: Please RSVP at SMByyc69 
PLEASE SUPPORT OUR GENEROUS SPONSOR 
Venue & Breakfast Sponsor: Calgary Marriott Hotel Downtown
